page.title: 05Giant's Caves : Banbury
page.content: Giant's Caves is a {country park}. It is on the Broughton Road leading out of Banbury. There is not a cave there it has been filled in, but it is a {picnic area}. It is a kind of leisure park. It is a bumpy bit of land. You couldn't grow crops on it or use it as grassland. You could use it as rough grazing land. But {Banbury} think it is better to be a public park. The cave is a very exciting place to be in. Giant's Cave is by the village of North Newington. Giant's Caves is a big place of about one acre. It has a place for childen to make camps. Jonathan Tibbetts
